titleproper.value: Guide to the William J. Benners Papers  <num>MSS.548</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Maxime La Fantasie, with portions reprocessed by William J. Levay.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-10-15T14:19:38</date>

abstract.value: William J. Benners, (1863-1940), was a writer, publisher, and historian of dime novels, a class of popular fiction that flourished in the mid to late nineteenth century and into the early twentieth. The William J. Benners Papers consist of letters to Benners from family members, various authors, and publishers, fragments of dime novel manuscripts, several research and accounting notebooks, and miscellany such as scrapbooks and photos. The collection includes material on and belonging to Benners gathered by Ralph Adimari during Adimari's extensive research on the history of the dime novel. It also includes some personal papers of dime novel authors Charles Garvice and Emma A. B. Sharkey (pseud. Mrs. E. Burke Collins), and publisher Frank Tousey.

p.value: Materials are open without restrictions. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date (if known); William J. Benners Papers; MSS 548; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Adimari, Ralph. "William J. Benners: The First Historian of the Dime Novel." <emph render="italic">Dime Novel Round-up</emph>, Vol. 26, No. 9, September 15, 1958.

The collection consists of personal correspondence from Benners's family and many dime novel authors, business correspondence from publishers, manuscript fragments, financial records and cancelled checks, notebooks, scrapbooks, and photographs.

Series I B: Galleys and manuscripts.Scope and Contents note

This series contains galleys and partial manuscripts for various dime novels.

Galleys and biographical sketch1894222General note

Galleys for Mary E. Bryan's A Modern Heathen, with notes by Benners; letter to Benners from publisher George Munro's Sons; biographical sketch of Bryan taken from the New York Ledger (with an Adimari notation).

Manuscript fragmentn.d.223General note

One page of MS for The Haunted Bayouby E. Burke Collins.

Manuscript fragmentn.d.224General note

Partial MS of an untitled piece by unknown author, with Adimari notation ("This may be E. Burke Collins?... Mrs. Miller?").

Manuscript fragmentn.d.225General note

First page of MS for Willful Goldie's Love Dreamby Daisy Darling.

Series I C: Notebooks and Miscellany.Scope and Contents note

Series IC contains several of Benners's notebooks, many of which were later annotated and reused by Ralph Adimari. Other ephemera (photos, scrapbooks, etc.) relating to Benners is also included.

Legal Agreement [Frank Leslie Publishing House]190231Manuscript: Benners biographyn.d.32General note

MS for a biographical sketch of Benners by E. Burke Collins.

Cancelled checks1894-191633General note

Cancelled checks, signed by Benners, issued by the Philadelphia Trust, Safe Deposit and Insurance Company.

Garvice, Charlesn.d.34General note

Notes, photos, and ads relating to British dime-novel author and friend of Benners, Charles Garvice.

Notebookn.d.35AGeneral note

List of serials and prices.

Notebookn.d.35BGeneral note

List of titles, miscellaneous notes.

Notebookn.d.36General note

Small memo book with Adimari's written label on first page: "Titles and Names up to 1929."

Notebookn.d.37General note

Benners's notebook with extensive notes by Adimari. Contents include: list of titles by publisher (Adimari); list of authors; one-page biography of Laura Jean Libby by Benners.

Emma Tell birthday albumn.d.38General note

An album of handwritten poems dedicated to Emma Tell.

Personal scrapbookn.d.39General note

Benners's personal scrapbook of clippings.

Book of stories1896-1916310General note

A bound volume of stories culled from various serials. Includes pieces from The Strand Magazineand Detective Story Magazine.

Notebookn.d.311General note

A book of bibliographical notes by Benners, later annotated and reused by Adimari.

Notebookn.d.312General note

Benners's notebook labeled "Expense Account", later used extensively by Adimari.
